cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / Sub-Tropical Storm strength (≤39 mph)
cyclone.current_location: about 75 mi NNW of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northeast on Friday, cross the southern and central Florida Peninsula Saturday, then emerge over the Atlantic and accelerate northeastward away from the Southeast U.S. coast toward open waters south of Bermuda.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern–central Florida Peninsula (around Fort Myers to West Palm Beach corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch in effect for the west coast of Florida south of the Middle of Longboat Key and for the east coast south of the Volusia/Brevard County line, including Lake Okeechobee and the Florida Keys.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and central Florida Peninsula, Florida Keys, and eventually Atlantic waters off the southeast U.S. coast.
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible, but the probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) is only 3%; winds generally expected to remain below 35 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor water‐level rises (<1 ft) possible due to onshore flow, but significant surge (>3 ft) not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands may bring 1–3 inches of rain with localized higher pockets; risk of brief heavy downpours and minor street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas and rip currents that could disrupt vessel movements and small-craft operations.
